page.title: 17SHEEP
page.content: There are several types of sheep. The most popular breeds are the Cheviot and Border Leicester sheep. The sheep (ewes) have had their lambs by April. The sheep normally just roam around the hills all day, but always return to their own area. The Cheviot is valuable because it is a good dual-purpose sheep, producing best quality mutton and wool. The sheep take their name from the Cheviot Hills between England and Scotland. They are distinguished by a hairless white face and straight ears. The Border Leicester is a very big sheep distinguished by high carriage of the head and a distinct Roman Nose.
